metadata.synopsis: Ginny (Mary Steenburgen) has a difficult time mustering Christmas spirit due to her husband Jack's (Gary Basaraba) unemployment and her humble position as a grocery store clerk. With the holiday fast approaching, Ginny and Jack's daughter, Abbie (Elizabeth Harnois), goes to deliver her letter to Santa. On her way, Abbie meets Gideon, an angel intent on saving Christmas from Ginny's poor attitude. With Gideon's magical assistance, Ginny learns how things could be much worse.

reviews: It's a godsend for parents, a movie you can take the kids to, but which won't leave you gnashing at the armrest halfway through.
Far too downbeat for the festive season.
Has the bite of a toothless old dog.
Phil Borsos' take on Christmas is a somewhat odd movie, but it does have a slow charm, not unlike It's a Wonderful Life by way of Wim Wenders.
'80s Christmas movie has depressing, intense scenes.
The most depressing Christmas movie of all time.
This is a treasure trove of sick laughs -- and it's from Disney!
Fantasy holiday fare has some good moments with Harry Dean Stanton.
A gloomy holiday tale that fails to enchant.
Screenwriter Thomas Meehan seems to have had It's a Wonderful Life in mind; the results are closer to A Nightmare on Elm Street.
This is very unfortunate. What we have here is a movie with an intelligent screenplay, wonderful performances and skillful direction, but it is a tactical miscalculation from beginning to end.
